item.title: Fanny Style
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: The fanny pack has always been a low brow joke of a product, most commonly associated with tourists and hipsters that just can't fit enough shit into their skinny jeans. Well, as runners we all know less is more, but you still need your essentials. Water, house keys, iPod, snacks, etc. Thus, I've provided a few options for the runners out there that may have  considered using such an accessory, but was never shown the way to the fanny... NIKE Le Force Waistpack : A classic in the fanny game. Nuff said. Hobo Triple Layer Nylon "Waist bag": Another option of the traditional fannypack, with a contemporary designer touch to it. Including leather detail, and multiple large compartments. Nike Hydration Belt : For the more technology/comfort suited runner, this bad boy will hold your water, keys, and iPod securely without the jigglage of some other less technologically inclined waistpacks. US GI Waist Pack: Finally, for the old-schoolers/utilitarians out there, there's this heavy hitter. It's known that the army makes some of the most functional and lasting products out there. May not be the most comfortable, but you know that shit's gonna last forever.

item.title: Bridgerunners to Celebrate "Community Day"
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded:
We've been following the campaign by a newly formed community group to give one of Manhattan's most blighted public spaces, Luther Gulick Park, a face lift. Sunday afternoon, they're hoping to draw a broad cross-section of the neighborhood to the park (Delancey and Willett Streets) for a "Community Day". The event organizers see this day as a way for the community to begin to reclaim the space, bring together diverse constituencies in the neighborhood, and draw attention and funding toward future park renovation. We'll be there!  Please Join!

Sunday, September 13th

1-4pm Luther Gulick Park (on Delancey Street, at Willett Street) The afternoon’s activities will include:

• Volunteer Gardening and Tree Care; • Handball and Basketball Tournaments with Prizes; • Face Painting and Origami Workshops; • Bike Check-ups; • Dog Demonstrations; • ‘Green’ Product Samples; • MUSIC and FUN!

item.title: The Most Irie Runner : Countryman
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: People get inspiration to start running from all different places. Some may want to lose weight, some start to train for a long term goal or marathon, and some do it because their doctor told them to. For me I've always enjoyed the act of running as transportation.  Unfortunately it's not always the best route, like say on the way to meeting up with your girlfriend's family for dinner. However, given a different environment and daily lifestyle, maybe running would just come second nature like it does for Countryman, a poor fisherman who has no car, no bike, and not even a pair of shoes. Just the grass under his feet and the people he meets on his way. After all those Jamaicans must be doing something that other runners aren't while training, I mean did you guys SEE the 2008 Olympics? Keep on Jammin Countrymen. Jah!

item.title: nOir Jewelry's Two-finger Bridge Ring

item.title: SOHO Night at The Drawing Center
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: Right down the street from the BRIDGERUNNER MEETING GROUNDS, the Drawing Center is having a FREE SOHO night. Join The Drawing Center and other not-for-profit visual arts institutions of SoHo for an evening of extended exhibition viewing, curator-led tours, and more! Did I mention Admission is FREE! SOHO Night Thurs. Sept 24th 6-9pm 35 Wooster Street DRAWINGCENTER.ORG T  212.219.2166 viaTheBLAAAHg

item.title: VIBRAM FIVE FINGERS : Bigfoot's Running Shoes
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: I'm reeeaallly diggin these. I heard about these from KATE over on Anna Sheffield's Blog. In response to the barefoot running movement, and geared to the active hippie, these shoes give the comfort and freedom of being barefoot and the support so you can get down and dirty in any terrain. For me personally i like the idea of being on a run and feeling comfortable enough to just start climbing a wall with the same shoes if you please. more at : http://www.vibramfivefingers.com

item.title: NYC ART BOOK FAIR 2009
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: Printed Matter, the world's largest nonprofit organization dedicated to publications made by artists, presents the fourth annual NY Art Book Fair, October 2-4 at P.S.1 Contemporary Art Center, Long Island City, Queens. The Fair previews on the evening of Thursday, October 1, followed by a benefit. Admission to the fair is FREE. LOCATION P.S.1 Contemporary Art Center 22-25 Jackson Ave at the intersection of 46th Ave Long Island City, NY 11101 (map) FAIR HOURS Friday/Saturday, October 2 & 3, 2009, 11am - 7pm Sunday, October 4, 2009, 11am - 5pm The NY Art Book Fair is FREE and open to the public.

item.title: NYC BridgeRunners 'We Run New York' Collection
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: New Bridge Runner tees and hoodies are being released tomorrow, Thursday Oct. 15th, over at 21 Mercer in Soho. Designed and created by the NYC Bridge Runners, the new colletion was customized using the iconic Nike Sportswear AW77 hoodie and NSW tee. Start the running season off right, make sure to scoop up your gear and rep the Bridge Runners crew while covering some ground.

item.title: Bridge Runner Wall at 21 Mercer
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: We are celebrating the 1 week anniversery of the BridgeRunners wall over at 21 Mercer. Designed by fellow Bridgerunner, Henry Lee, the wall's lookin as beautiful as the day it went up. If you haven't seen it yet, guess you'll see it tonight.

item.title: The Spike Jonze X Kanye West Film Everyone's talking about...
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: If you haven't seen it yet, the new Spike Jonze / Kanye West short film just got released over at Dailymotion. Personally, I didn't like it at first , but by the end I thought it was pretty sick. You be the judge though. Looks like Kanye's making his way to the big screen. The Takeover.

item.title: SUE KWON : Street Level
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: With a recent show being completed over at Clic Gallery, and the newly released Street Level, compiling a  20 year collection of her work, Sue's definitely a beast in the photo game . A New York resident, Sue Kwon has enprinted a heavy footprint upon the photography world, giving us a slew of both commercial and documentary photography, that influences one to record their own lives through photos. Shooting legends like Biggie and the Beastie Boys, she photographed a transitional period in our lives that gave us a look into epic tranformation of Hip Hop, while also allowing us also see the dwindling remains of what many remember as old New York. Check out the interview I just had the pleasure of doing with her HERE and make sure to pic up her book, Street Level, its a perfect addition to any coffee table. Mad love. peace!

item.title: RZA Talks With Bridgerunner Noah Rubin
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: Check out this conversation between Wu Tang mastermind RZA and Bridgerunner Noah Rubin over on Complex.com. Rubin produced a gang of tracks on Wu Tang Chamber Music that dropped a couple months back and parts of this convo were used as interludes for the record. From Complex: It’s been a productive year for RZA. He had his usual place at the boards, executive-producing the critically acclaimed compilation Wu-Tang Chamber Music and Raekwon’s stunning OB4CL2, but added to that another underrated acting role in Judd Apatow’s Funny People and a second go-around as writer, dropping his spiritual mashup book, The Tao of Wu, earlier this month. And in the middle of all that, he took some time to sit down (with writer/musician Noah Rubin, who produced some of the tracks on Wu-Tang Chamber Music) and discuss everything from the stories behind The Tao of Wu to ODB to his continuing quest for enlightenment. Bong bong! Read the full article here: Complex.com

item.title: Lance Armstrong Reps BridgeRunners
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: After hearing that Lance Armstrong was organizing a last minute run via twitter, we threw some shirts together at the 255 Elizabeth in light of the event. Printed on white dry fits with the slogan "Not Scared," Lance gave us the smile of approval. Maybe he'll rock it for the marathon tomorrow! We'll see... keep beastin Lance.

item.title: Buffalo Cantina Suicide Challenge!!!
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: So I was walking home from Hope Lounge after having a relaxing end of day Red Stripe, and decided to stop in at the Buffalo Cantina for some tacos. Waiting there with my buddy JOE, we start noticing a little scene start across the restuarant. When I turned my head fully to see what was up, I see two peole with a large platter of wings on the table and a collection of small empty cups of milk. It turned out that the Buffalo Cantina is infamous for their super hot "Suicide 6" wings. I couldn't help myself but to crack up at the site of the masicists in knots over appropriately named hot wings, but more importantly was the fact that in my pocket was the new ipod nano WITH video in my pocket. Show time... watch the challange unfold.... NOTE : I accidentally called Mr. Adam Richman, host of Man vs. Food, the Man vs Wild guy. I just wanted to say to Adam Richman wherever he is out there...no disrespects to your sport or the challenge of eating the most blood clotting and heart attack endusing foods out there. YOU are the man, not that other dude from Man vs Wild... yes. Enjoy the video and check out 'Man vs Food' tonight at 10pm if you wanna see what happens to the Pro.

item.title: Post Run Laughter
item.dc:creator: Rizmo
item.content:encoded: Come out after the run and show some support for our buddy Terrence Gerechberg, as well as the rest of the crew of funny makers. Wednesday (Nov. 18th) The charge is $15 (that's the ONLY cost) what you get - open wine bar from 7:30-8:30pm. Show starts at 8:30pm & should be done at 10-10:30pm. During the comedy show you don't have to buy any drinks. But if you choose to, there will be drink specials ($3 buds & $5 vodkas). To RSVP : Call Jonathon Powley at 212-960-3604 or e-mail him at jplaughs@gmail.com Buns & Puns at Arlo & Esme: 42 East 1st Street | New York, New York 10003 | 212.960.3604 | info@bunsandpuns.com
